q8388415.brero_massimiliano.PTNetEditor.utils

Class PTNNodeHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • q8388415.brero_massimiliano.PTNetEditor.utils.PTNNodeHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class PTNNodeHelper
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Offers methods for dealing with node computations, like getting an instance of the control panel for adding listeners for new nodes. Kind of a lightweight delegate class.
    Author:
    q8388415 - Massimiliano Brero

    • Method Detail

      • addPlaceListener

        public void addPlaceListener(PlaceView place)
        Adds a scale listener PTNIScaleListener to a place node. So view will react to scale events.
        Parameters:
        place - PlaceView

      • addTransitionListener

        public void addTransitionListener(TransitionView transition)
        Adds a scale listener PTNIScaleListener to a transition node. So view will react to scale events.
        Parameters:
        transition - TransitionView

      • handleContextmenu

        public void handleContextmenu(NodeView sourceView)
        Generates a context menu for given node. Adds needed listeners to this JPopupMenu and will so make sure that the context menu: *
        • gets mouse events
        • disappears with a click on the desktop (or the control panel)
        • moves with the main frame
        Parameters:
        sourceView - NodeView

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Handles the two kinds of dialogs coming from the node's context menu:
        • changing node attributes
        • deleting arcs
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • initNodeView

        public void initNodeView(java.lang.String name,
                NodeView nodeView,
                java.awt.Point nodeLocation)
        Prepares a new node view so it my be displayed on the desktop. A new transition view's status will be set to activated.
        Parameters:
        name - String Node name.
        nodeView - NodeView
        nodeLocation - Point

      • updateNodeModelLocation

        public void updateNodeModelLocation(NodeView nodeView)
        Sets the new location in node model when node was moved or created.
        Parameters:
        nodeView -

      • updateAdjacentTransitionsState

        public void updateAdjacentTransitionsState(PTNINodeDTO source)
        When the token attribute of a place has been changed, this methods checks if the state of succeeding transitions must be updated.
        Parameters:
        source - PTNINodeDTO

      • updateTransitionState

        public void updateTransitionState(PTNINodeDTO node)
        This method checks if the transition's activation state has to be changed, e. g. after an arc has been deleted. Accepts either node views or node models.
        Parameters:
        node - PTNINodeDTO By using PTNINodeDTO we may pass either a node view or a node model.

      • generateId

        public java.lang.String generateId()
        Generates a unique id concatenating id prefix and a random number. It also checks id number is already present
        Returns:
        String New id for an arc.

      • centerNodeLocation

        public java.awt.Point centerNodeLocation(PTNINodeDTO nodeInformation)
        Relocates node so the node's icon enter is placed on the given location. This way a new node is places after a double click where the user would expect it.
        Parameters:
        nodeInformation - PTNINodeDTO
        Returns:
        Point The center of the node.

      • iconContainsPoint

        public boolean iconContainsPoint(NodeView sourceNodeView,
                        java.awt.Point point)
        Checks if an icon in a node contains the given point. We use this when we want to make sure that an method is only called when the mouse is right on the icon and not somewhere else in the node's JLabel object.
        Parameters:
        sourceNodeView - NodeView The coordinates are those relative to the node's JLabel (0,0) point.
        point - Point
        Returns:
        Boolean
